column12: BIOSENSOR FOR THE DETECTION OF PHOSPHATIDIC ACID IN CELL MEMBRANES
column13: The invention relates to fusion proteins comprising a fragment of the protein Spo20, the fluorescent protein ECFP and the fluorescent protein Venus or a variant thereof. The invention also relates to the nucleotide sequence comprising same, and to the use thereof for the in vitro detection and/or quantification of phosphatidic acid in cell membranes, for example, the plasma membrane or the mitochondrial membrane. The invention further relates to a screening method using the fusion proteins of the invention.
column15: LLOPIS BORRAS JUAN FRANCISCO;;FERRAZ NOGUEIRA JOSE PEDRO

column12: BIOSENSOR FOR THE DETECTION OF PHOSPHATIDIC ACID IN CELL MEMBRANES
column13: The invention relates to fusion proteins comprising a fragment of the protein Spo20, the fluorescent protein ECFP and the fluorescent protein Venus or a variant thereof. The invention also relates to the nucleotide sequence comprising same, and to the use thereof for the in vitro detection and/or quantification of phosphatidic acid in cell membranes, for example, the plasma membrane or the mitochondrial membrane. column15: LLOPIS BORRAS JUAN FRANCISCO;;FERRAZ NOGUEIRA JOSE PEDRO

column12: DEVICE FOR DETERMINING THE POROSITY OF THIN FILMS AND USE THEREOF
column13: The invention relates to a device which can be used to determine the adsorption/desorption isotherms and porosity in thin films, supported membranes and directly supported nanostructured materials. For this purpose, the adsorption and desorption isotherms of the sample are determined and subsequently used to determine the type of porosity of the sample, as well as the pore volume and pore size distribution thereof, using solid surface thermodynamic and physicochemical concepts.
